description: From Middle English wong, wang, from Old English wang, wong, from Proto-West Germanic *wang, from Proto-Germanic *wangaz. Cognate with Danish vang.

entries.meaning: (obsolete or dialectal, chiefly in placenames) A field or other piece of land.

description: From the pen name Stanford Wong.

verbs.description: wong (third-person singular simple present wongs, present participle wonging, simple past and past participle wonged)

entries.meaning: (gambling) To enter a betting game, particularly blackjack, when the odds are favorable.
In the game of pai gow, a hand in which the double-one or double-six domino is used with a nine, making the hand worth eleven points rather than the usual one.
